column2: Kathy, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After years of suffering with diarrhea, cramping, abdominal bloating & gas from collagenous colitis, & the side effects of the other medications previously prescribed to treat it, a new gastroenterologist prescribed cholestyramine. (Studies show that many people w/ colitis secrete too much bile which irritates the colon & thereby causes the symptoms.Cholestyramine binds to the bile & prevents the irritation.) My positive response was immediate. I adjust the dose based on symptoms - & usually take about 1 - 1 1/2 teaspoons per day. Am now able to eat whatever I want without pain, whereas before my diet was severly limited. The only downside is scheduling because it binds  to bile, but also to other drugs & supplements & therefore must be taken 2 hours before or 4 hours after other drugs.The only possible side effect I'm aware of is that everything tastes off to me - I'm wondering if other people have had this effect.

column2: mcsmilern, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had Crohn's disease for over 13 years.  I am returning to school to become an RN and had been worried about frequent uncontrolled bathroom runs.  Three months ago I ended up with an intestinal blockage and was hospitalized~then discovering I had fistulas growing and must have surgery right away.  After surgery I continued to struggle with "no warning" bathroom emergencies.  I was eating very mild, bland, and easy to digest foods and still really struggling.  After spending a week calling my Dr.'s every day I finally received the Rx for Cholestyramine.  It has been a life saver and I no longer worry about starting the RN program in three weeks.  Control after so many years~What a Blessing!!       I did a little research as to how/why this Med works and found out why there were so many problems after surgery.  Our bile salts are usually reabsorbed at the end of the terminal Ilium (small intestine) with that segment gone the salts continue on into the large colon~~where there is salt there is water sure to follow.  Causing severe/uncontrollable diarrhea.  This Med binds to those bile salts and gives them bulk, giving us tremendous relief!
